comment.shortText:
Any body that you want to add to your request: this can be a Blob, BufferSource, FormData,
URLSearchParams, ReadableStream, or USVString object.
comment.text: Note that a request using the GET or HEAD method cannot have a body.

comment.shortText: The cache mode you want to use for the request: default, no-store, reload, no-cache, or force-cache.

The request credentials you want to use for the request: omit, same-origin, or include.
The default is omit.
comment.text: In Chrome the default is same-origin before Chrome 47 and include starting with Chrome 47.

comment.shortText: Any headers you want to add to your request, contained within a Headers object or an object literal with ByteString values.
Contains the subresource integrity value of the request (e.g., sha256-BpfBw7ivV8q2jLiT13fxDYAe2tJllusRSZ273h2nFSE=).
The request method, e.g., GET, POST.

The mode you want to use for the request, e.g., cors, no-cors, same-origin, or navigate.
The default is cors.
comment.text: In Chrome the default is no-cors before Chrome 47 and same-origin starting with Chrome 47.

comment.shortText: The redirect mode to use: follow, error, or manual.
comment.text: In Chrome the default is follow before Chrome 47 and manual starting with Chrome 47.

comment.shortText: A USVString specifying no-referrer, client, or a URL. The default is client.
An AbortSignal to set requestâ€™s signal.

The init object used to initialize a fetch Request.
See https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Request/Request
